comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This is not a Salmson 2 A2, but rather a Breguet 14 B2 bomber. Note te square radiator in the nose section and vertical exhaust stack. Tailplane and slab-sided fuselage differ significantly from the rounded Salmson fuselage. The Breguet was flown by and only fully equipped the 96th Aero Squadron when flown in US Service. (In French Service, it, of course, was the major bomber type utilized from October 1917 to the end of the war.
